intro: Ecbolium arabicum, commonly known as the desert milkweed, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of the Middle East and North Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and milky sap. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to withstand high temperatures and low precipitation. Its leaves are narrow and succulent, helping to reduce water loss. Ecbolium arabicum plays a role in supporting local pollinators and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
